CREATIVE.Definition: producing or using original and unusual ideas

ADVICE.Definition: an opinion that someone offers you about what you should do or how you should act in a particular situation

MAKING A LIVING.Definition: to earn enough money to buy the things you need

DISCRIMINATE.Definition: to treat a person or particular group of people differently, especially in a worse way from the way in which you treat other people, because of their skin color, sex, sexuality, etc.

FIGURE OUT.Definition: to finally understand something or someone, or find the solution to a problem after a lot of thought

CLAIM.Definition: to say that something is true or is a fact, although you cannot prove it and other people might not believe it

CONCISE.Definition: short and clear, expressing what needs to be said without unnecessary words

VAGUE.Definition: not clearly expressed, known, described, or decided

ARTIST.Definition: someone who creates things with great skill and imagination

ENTREPRENEUR.Definition: someone who starts their own business, especially when this involves seeing a new opportunity

INTERCHANGEABLY.Definition: in a way that can be exchanged without making any difference or without being noticed

DURATION.Definition: the length of time that something lasts

VICE VERSA.Definition: used to say that what you have just said is also true in the opposite order

IMPRESSION.Definition: an idea or opinion of what something or someone is like

VULNERABILITY.Definition: the quality of being vulnerable (= able to be easily hurt, influenced, or attacked), or something that is vulnerable

LOFTY.Definition: lofty ideas, etc. are of a high moral standard

ASPIRATIONS.Definition: something that you hope to achieve

RUSHING.Definition: to (cause to) go or do something very quickly

MANIPULATIVE.Definition: tending to influence or control someone or something to your advantage, often without anyone knowing it

COME ACROSS.Definition: to find something or someone by chance

NEGLECT.Definition: to not give enough care or attention to people or things that are your responsibility

CONSISTENTLY.Definition: in a way that does not change

CROSSES THEIR MIND.Definition: if something crosses your mind, you think of it

STRUCTURE.Definition: the way in which the parts of a system or object are arranged or organized, or a system arranged in this way

ADHERING TO.Definition: to continue to obey a rule or have a belief

THRIVE.Definition: to grow, develop, or be successful

GLAMOROUS.Definition: attractive in an exciting and special way

GUARANTEE.Definition: a promise that something will be done or will happen

LIBERAL.Definition: someone who respects many different types of beliefs or behavior

DEMONIZE.Definition: to try to make someone or a group of people seem as if they are evil

CAPITALISM.Definition: an economic system based on private ownership of property and business, with the goal of making the greatest possible profits for the owners

PRODUCTION.Definition: the activity of organizing the practical and financial matters relating to the preparation of a movie, play, or television or radio program, etc.

DESCRIPTIVE.Definition: describing something, especially in a detailed, interesting way

MONITOR.Definition: to watch and check a situation carefully for a period of time in order to discover something about it

ENGAGE.Definition: to interest someone in something and keep them thinking about it; to become involved, or have contact, with someone or something

FEEDBACK.Definition: reaction to a process or activity, or the information obtained from such a reaction

TRENDS.Definition: the general direction of changes or developments

FIELD.Definition: an area of activity or interest

END UP.Definition: to reach or come to a place, condition, or situation that was not planned or expected

METAVERSE.Definition: the internet considered as an imaginary area without limits where you can meet people in virtual reality (= images and sounds, produced by a computer, that seem to represent a real place or situation)

DELEGATED.Definition: to give a particular job, duty, right, etc. to someone else so that they do it for you

ROB.Definition: if someone is robbed of something they deserve or want, it is taken away from them

CONCLUDE.Definition: to judge or decide something after thinking carefully about it

FUNDAMENTALS.Definition: the main or most important rules or parts

INFRASTRUCTURE.Definition: the underlying foundation or basic framework (as of a system or organization)

DAUNTING.Definition: making you feel slightly frightened or worried about your ability to achieve something

TAKE IT FOR GRANTED.Definition: to never think about something because you believe it will always be available or stay exactly the same

NAVIGATE.Definition: to move around within a website or between websites

LEGENDARY.Definition: very famous and admired or spoken about

CAUSE.Definition: a socially valuable principle that is strongly supported by some people

ASS.Definition: used as a postpositive intensive especially with words of derogatory implication

STRETCH.Definition: to go as far as or past the usual limit of something

MONETIZE.Definition: to change something into money, or to express something in terms of money or a currency

AT THE END OF THE DAY.Definition: something that you say before you give the most important fact of a situation

SUBJECTIVE.Definition: influenced by or based on personal beliefs or feelings, rather than based on facts

COMES DOWN TO.Definition: if a situation or decision comes down to something, that is the thing that influences it most

HARNESS.Definition: to collect and control something so that it can be used effectively

TIE UP.Definition: to cause something, often money or possessions, not to be available for use

OVERT.Definition: done or shown obviously or publicly; not hidden or secret

FIGURATIVE.Definition: (of words and phrases) used not with their basic meaning but with a more imaginative meaning, in order to create a special effect

METAPHOR.Definition: an expression, often found in literature, that describes a person or object by referring to something that is considered to have similar characteristics to that person or object

ESSENCE.Definition: the basic or most important idea or quality of something

PRECIOUS.Definition: of great value because of being rare, expensive, or important

CAN'T AFFORD.Definition: if you cannot afford to do something, you must not do it because it would cause serious problems for you

POVERTY.Definition: the condition of being extremely poor

THINK OUTSIDE THE BOX.Definition: to think imaginatively using new ideas instead of traditional or expected ideas

HABIT.Definition: something that you do often and regularly, sometimes without knowing that you are doing it

EFFICIENT.Definition: working or operating quickly and effectively in an organized way

YOU FEEL ME?.Definition: informal way of asking 'do you understand what I am saying?'

SUBCONSCIOUSLY.Definition: in a way that uses or relates to the subconscious (= the part of your mind that notices and remembers information when you are not actively trying to do so, and influences your behavior even though you do not realize it)

FEATURE FILM.Definition: a movie that is usually 90 or more minutes long

POINT-AND-SHOOT.Definition: having or using preset or automatically adjusted controls (as for focus or shutter speed)

IMITATING.Definition: to behave in a similar way to someone or something else, or to copy the speech or behavior, etc. of someone or something

KEY.Definition: the most important part of achieving something or explaining a situation

BLOW UP.Definition: to suddenly become very successful, prevalent, or popular

TEMPTED.Definition: to entice to do wrong by promise of pleasure or gain

PEERS.Definition: one that is of equal standing with another : equal

DIFFERENTIATE.Definition: to make someone or something different

SHINE THROUGH.Definition: if a quality shines through, it is strong and easy to see, usually in a particular situation

TERMS.Definition: provisions that determine the nature and scope of an agreement

CONDITIONS.Definition: a premise upon which the fulfillment of an agreement depend

LOSER.Definition: a person who is always unsuccessful at everything they do

BACK ON YOUR FEET.Definition: well or successful again after being sick or having problems

INEVITABLY.Definition: in a way that cannot be avoided

LONG HAUL.Definition: something that takes effort over a long time, rather than just a few days, weeks, etc.

MARATHON.Definition: a long race, run on roads, of 26.2 miles or 42.2 kilometers; an activity that takes a long time and makes you very tired

SPRINT.Definition: a short race run at full speed, or any short period of fast running

ROME WASN'T BUILT IN A DAY.Definition: said to emphasize that you cannot expect to do important things in a short period of time

DETACH.Definition: to separate or remove something from something else that it is connected to

TAKE A STEP BACK.Definition: withdraw or remove oneself from something, often in order to consider it from a broader or more objective perspective

EXECUTION.Definition: the act of doing or performing something, especially in a planned way

THE SHIT.Definition: someone or something that is excellent and exemplary

IMAGINARY.Definition: existing only in imagination : lacking factual reality

REAL-WORLD.Definition: happening in the world or in someone's life rather than in a book, in the imagination, on the internet, etc.

STREAM.Definition: to send or receive sound or video directly over the internet as a continuous flow

THE SURFACE.Definition: the surface of a situation or person is what they appear to be, or the features they have that are not hidden or difficult to see

EMBARKING.Definition: to engage, enlist, or invest in an enterprise

RIDICULOUSLY.Definition: in a way that is stupid or unreasonable and deserves to be laughed at

SELF-AWARE.Definition: knowing and understanding yourself very well

PRAGMATIC.Definition: based on practical judgments rather than principles

DRIFTING.Definition: to move slowly, esp. as a result of outside forces, with no control over direction

YOU KNOW WHAT I'M SAYING?.Definition: used to ask if someone understands or agrees with you, especially if you have not expressed yourself very clearly

CUT THAT SHIT OUT.Definition: to put an end to : desist from

RESIST.Definition: to stop yourself from doing something that you want to do

URGE.Definition: a strong wish, especially one that is difficult or impossible to control

IMPRESS.Definition: to affect especially forcibly or deeply : gain the admiration or interest of

MISSING OUT.Definition: to fail to use an opportunity to enjoy or get an advantage from something

GOLDEN YEARS.Definition: the advanced years in a lifetime

SET YOURSELF UP.Definition: to establish someone or yourself in a business or position

HOLDING YOU DOWN.Definition: to keep someone or something in a particular place or position and to stop him, her, or it from moving

HOLDING YOU BACK.Definition: to stop someone or something developing or doing as well as they should

AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.Definition: in or within a short time; before long; quickly

NO CLUE.Definition: to be completely unable to guess, understand, or deal with something

ACQUIRED.Definition: to obtain or begin to have something

SCHEME.Definition: an organized plan for doing something, especially something dishonest or illegal that will bring a good result for you

DOWNPAYMENT.Definition: an amount of money that you pay at the time that you buy something but is only a part of the total cost of that thing. You usually pay the rest of the cost over a period of time

SPIRIT.Definition: a particular way of thinking, feeling, or behaving, especially a way that is typical of a particular group of people, an activity, a time, or a place

CHARISMA.Definition: a special power that some people have naturally that makes them able to influence other people and attract their attention and admiration

UNDERESTIMATE.Definition: to think that something is or will be smaller, easier, less extreme, or less important than it really is

NONSENSE.Definition: an idea, something said or written, or behaviour that is silly or stupid

KICKING OUR KIDS OUT.Definition: to force someone to leave a place or organization

TRAIN OF THOUGHT.Definition: a series of connected thoughts or events

HANG ON.Definition: to wait for a short time

SPLIT.Definition: to (cause to) divide into two or more parts, especially along a particular line

VENTURE.Definition: a new activity, usually in business, that involves risk or uncertainty

CAUGHT UP IN.Definition: so involved in an activity that you do not notice other things

GRATEFUL.Definition: showing or expressing thanks, especially to another person

RUN INTO A WALL.Definition: to come up against an immovable or insurmountable difficulty or obstacle

WANNABE.Definition: a person who wants or aspires to be someone or something else or who tries to look or act like someone else

PERFECTIONIST.Definition: a person who wants everything to be perfect and demands the highest standards possible

NIP SOMETHING IN THE BUD.Definition: to stop something before it has an opportunity to become established

ROOT.Definition: the cause or origin of something bad

ERADICATE.Definition: to get rid of something completely or destroy something bad

MOTHERFUCKER.Definition: an offensive word for thing that you dislike or that has made you angry

UNROOT.Definition: to tear up by the roots : eradicate, uproot

FINISHING TOUCHES.Definition: the last thing done to make something complete

CRITICIZE.Definition: to find fault with : point out the faults of

SUCK.Definition: slang, sometimes vulgar : to be objectionable or inadequate

EXTENSION.Definition: the fact of reaching, stretching, or continuing; the act of adding to something in order to make it bigger or longer

RIDICULES.Definition: to laugh at someone in an unkind way

A SHIT.Definition: a minimum amount or degree (as of care or consideration)

NO HARD FEELINGS.Definition: the phrase no hard feelings is used in speech to say that you are not upset or to ask if someone else is upset

ENDURANCE.Definition: the ability to keep doing something difficult, unpleasant, or painful for a long time

TOXIC.Definition: causing you a lot of harm and unhappiness over a long period of time; very unpleasant or unacceptable

FLOW.Definition: a situation in which something is produced or moved continuously

WISDOM.Definition: the ability to use your knowledge and experience to make good decisions and judgments

COMPLACENT.Definition: feeling so satisfied with your own abilities or situation that you feel you do not need to try any harder

INNOVATING.Definition: to introduce changes and new ideas

AHEAD OF THE GAME.Definition: to know more about the most recent developments in a particular subject or activity than the people or companies you are competing against

PLAYING CATCH UP.Definition: to try to be as successful as other people, companies, etc.

THE ROAD LESS TRAVELED.Definition: a choice made in oneâ€™s life that is unconventional, a choice that leads one in a different direction than most people
